item.title: Formatting and validating dates in JavaScript
item.description: Date Formats Dates come in multiple formats: a Unix timestamp (1481884441) an ISO 8601 string (2016-11-04T17:39:59.910Z) a locale string (Thursday, December 20, 2012, GMT) Let’s get started by defining some variables to use in our examples const UNIX = 1481884441 const ISO8601 = '2016-11-04T17:39:59.910Z' const invalidISO = '2016-31-31T17:39:59.910Z' const invalidDate = '2016/31/31' let date = Date.now() // Date.now() is faster than new Date() Date.now() vs. new Date() Note that while Date.
